org.jruyi.core

Interface IFilterChain


  • public interface IFilterChain
    A filter chain is a container of IFilters that process data in series. The output of the previous filter is the input of the next one. For inbound, data flows from the first filter to the last one; for outbound, data flows from the last filter to the first one.
    Since:
    2.2

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IFilterChain addAfter(java.lang.String targetFilterName, java.lang.String name, IFilter<?,?> filter)
      Adds the specified filter with the specified name after the target filter named the specified targetFilterName.
      IFilterChain addBefore(java.lang.String targetFilterName, java.lang.String name, IFilter<?,?> filter)
      Adds the specified filter with the specified name before the target filter named the specified targetFilterName.
      IFilterChain addFirst(java.lang.String name, IFilter<?,?> filter)
      Adds the specified filter with the specified name to the first of this chain.
      IFilterChain addLast(java.lang.String name, IFilter<?,?> filter)
      Adds the specified filter with the specified name to the last of this chain.
      void clear()
      Empties this filter chain.
      boolean contains(java.lang.String name)
      Tests if the specified filter name in this chain.
      IFilter<?,?> get(java.lang.String name)
      Gets the filter called the specified name.
      IFilter<?,?> remove(java.lang.String name)
      Removes the specified filter name from the chain.
      IFilter<?,?> replace(java.lang.String name, IFilter<?,?> newFilter)
      Replaces the specified filter with the specified newFilter.

      • addAfter

        IFilterChain addAfter(java.lang.String targetFilterName,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    IFilter<?,?> filter)
        Adds the specified filter with the specified name after the target filter named the specified targetFilterName.
        Parameters:
        targetFilterName - the name of the target filter
        name - the name of the filter to add
        filter - the filter to add
        Returns:
        this filter chain
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified filter is not found in the chain

                   IFilter<?,?> newFilter)
        Replaces the specified filter with the specified newFilter.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the filter to be replaced
        newFilter - the filter to replace
        Returns:
        the replaced old filter, or null if not found

      • remove

        IFilter<?,?> remove(java.lang.String name)
        Removes the specified filter name from the chain.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the filter to be removed
        Returns:

      • contains

        boolean contains(java.lang.String name)
        Tests if the specified filter name in this chain.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the filter to be searched for
        Returns:
        true if the specified filter name is found in this chain, otherwise false
